Package chess.interfaces

Interface IChessMove

All Known Implementing Classes:
ChessMove
public interface IChessMove
Defines the move a chess piece is capable of according to the current situation on the chessboard. As an example, let's consider the same rook from IChessMoveInfo. This rook can only 7 tiles down and 7 tiles to the right if and only if there are no pieces blocking it. Therefore, the actual squares a chess piece could arrive using one of its defined moves is based on the state of the board. Thus, IChessMove provides a representation of what a chess piece is actually capable of using one of its movements.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    boolean
    canReach(IChessboardSquare square)
    Determines whether move allows the chess piece reach the defined square on the board.
    IChessPiece
    owner()
    Gets the chess piece for which the move is defined.
    List<IChessboardSquare>
    possibilities()
    Gets the possible destination squares this move of the chess piece can lead to.

  • Method Details

    • canReach

      boolean canReach(IChessboardSquare square)
      Determines whether move allows the chess piece reach the defined square on the board.
      Returns:
      True, if the provided square is within the list of possibilities this chess piece has for this move. False, otherwise.

    • owner

      IChessPiece owner()
      Gets the chess piece for which the move is defined.

    • possibilities

      List<IChessboardSquare> possibilities()
      Gets the possible destination squares this move of the chess piece can lead to. Remark: So, if this move of a chess piece allows the piece to 3 squares to the left, then the list is of size 3 as it contains each of the 3 possible squares the piece can move to.
